Allure reporter (opens new window) is a tool to store and display test reports. It provides nice web UI which contains all important information on test execution. CodeceptJS has built-in support for Allure reports. Inside reports you will have all steps, substeps and screenshots.

Allure reporter is a tool to store and display test reports. It provides nice web UI which contains all important information on test execution. CodeceptJS has built-in support for Allure reports. Inside reports you will have all steps, substeps and screenshots.
trans-unit.target: Allure Reporter es una herramienta para almacenar y mostrar informes de prueba. Proporciona una interfaz de usuario web agradable que contiene toda la información importante sobre la ejecución de la prueba. CodeceptJS tiene soporte incorporado para informes Allure. Dentro de los informes tendrás todos los pasos, subpasos y capturas de pantalla.

trans-unit.source: Protractor (opens new window) is an official tool for testing AngularJS applications. CodeceptJS should not be considered as alternative to Protractor, but rather a testing framework that leverages this powerful library.
Selenoid (opens new window) plugin automatically starts browsers and video recording. Works with WebDriver helper.

Selenoid (opens new window) is a modern way to run Selenium inside Docker containers. Selenoid is easy to set up and provides more features than original Selenium Server. Use selenoidOptions to set Selenoid capabilities

Autocomplete (with InteliSence) (opens new window) - a tool that streamlines your work by suggesting when you typing what function or property which exists in a class, what arguments can be passed to that method, what it returns, etc. Example:
within operator can be used to work inside IFrames. Special frame locator is required to locate the iframe and get into its context.
trans-unit.target: dentro del operador se puede usar para trabajar dentro de IFrames. Se requiere un localizador de frame especial para ubicar el iframe y entrar en su contexto.

trans-unit.source: ApiDataFactory (opens new window) helper, and,

GraphQL helper (opens new window) allows sending GraphQL queries and mutations to application, over Http. This is a tool to make shortcuts and create your data pragmatically via GraphQL endpoint. However, it doesn't provide tools for testing the endpoint, so it should be paired with WebDriver, Nightmare or Protractor helpers for browser testing.
GraphQLDataFactory (opens new window) helper.

REST helper (opens new window) allows sending raw HTTP requests to application. This is a tool to make shortcuts and create your data pragmatically via API. However, it doesn't provide tools for testing APIs, so it should be paired with WebDriver, Nightmare or Protractor helpers for browser testing.

REST helper uses Unirest library to send HTTP requests to application. However, it doesn't provide tools for testing APIs, so it should be paired with WebDriverIO, Nightmare or Protractor helpers for browser testing.
trans-unit.target: El ayudante REST usa la biblioteca Unirest para enviar solicitudes HTTP a la aplicación. Sin embargo, no proporciona herramientas para probar las API, por lo que debe emparejarse con los ayudantes WebDriverIO, Nightmare o Protractor para las pruebas del navegador.

TestCafe (opens new window) is another alternative engine for driving browsers. It is driven by unique technology which provides fast and simple cross browser testing for desktop and mobile browsers. Unlike WebDriver or Puppeteer, TestCafe doesn't control a browser at all. It is not a browser itself, like Nightmare or Cypress. TestCafe core is a proxy server that runs behind the scene, and transforms all HTML and JS to include code that is needed for test automation.

@codeceptjs/configure package (opens new window) contains shared recipes for common configuration patterns. This allows to set meta-configuration, independent from a current helper enabled.
codeceptjs-resources-check (opens new window) Load a URL with Puppeteer and listen to the requests while the page is loading. Enabling count the number or check the sizes of the requests.

codeceptjs-rphelper (opens new window) is a CodeceptJS helper which can publish tests results on ReportPortal after execution.
codeceptjs-CodeGenerator (opens new window) is a CodeceptJS custom wrapper which can create page class with action methods from the page object file(JSON) and project setup(Folder Structure).
codeceptjs-tbhelper (opens new window) - a helper which updates Test Names & Test Results on TestingBot
codeceptjs-http (opens new window) - a helper which wraps then-request library to process HTTP requests. It's alternative helper that provides more flexible request management.
codeceptjs-httpmock (opens new window) - a helper which wraps mockttp library to manage http mock in tests.
codeceptjs-cmdhelper (opens new window) allows you to run commands in the terminal/console
codeceptjs-dbhelper (opens new window) - allows you to execute queries or commands to databases using database-js.

trans-unit.source: --grep "\@smoke2|\@smoke3" - run tests with @smoke2 or @smoke3 in name
trans-unit.target: --grep "\@smoke2|\@smoke3" - ejecuta pruebas con @ smoke2 o @ smoke3 en nombre

trans-unit.source: --grep '((?=.*@smoke2)(?=.*@smoke3))|@smoke4' - run tests with (@smoke2 and @smoke3) or @smoke4 in name
trans-unit.target: --grep '((?=.*@smoke2)(?=.*@smoke3))|@smoke4' - ejecute pruebas con (@ smoke2 y @ smoke3) o @ smoke4 en el nombre

trans-unit.source: --grep '(?=.*)^(?!.*@smoke4)' - run all tests except @smoke4
trans-unit.target: --grep '(?=.*)^(?!.*@smoke4)' - ejecuta todas las pruebas excepto @ smoke4

trans-unit.source: --grep '(?=.*@smoke2)(?=.*@smoke3)' - run tests with @smoke2 and @smoke3 in name
trans-unit.target: --grep '(?=.*@smoke2)(?=.*@smoke3)' - ejecuta pruebas con @ smoke2 y @ smoke3 en el nombre

trans-unit.source: --grep '(?=.*@smoke2)^(?!.*@smoke3)' - run tests with @smoke2 but without @smoke3 in name
trans-unit.target: --grep '(?=.*@smoke2)^(?!.*@smoke3)' - ejecuta pruebas con @ smoke2 pero sin @ smoke3 en el nombre

trans-unit.source: grabTextFrom action is used here to retrieve text from an element. All actions starting with grab prefix are expected to return data. In order to synchronize this step with a scenario you should pause test execution with await keyword of ES6. To make it work your test should be written inside a async function (notice async in its definition).
trans-unit.target: grabTextFrom acción grabTextFrom se utiliza aquí para recuperar texto de un elemento. Se espera que todas las acciones que comienzan con el prefijo grab devuelvan datos. Con el fin de sincronizar este paso con un escenario que debe hacer una pausa en la ejecución de pruebas con await palabra clave de ES6. Para que funcione, su prueba debe escribirse dentro de una función asíncrona (observe la async en su definición).

trans-unit.source: If you are using Windows machine or if autoCreate does not work properly, create container manually

Magic. Browsers executed in TestCafe are not aware that they run in test mode. So at some edges automation control can be broken. It's also quite hard to debug possible issues, as you don't know how actually a web page is parsed to inject automation scripts.
Manual - you create the conatainer and configure it with a plugin (recommended).

No Browser Control. Because TestCafe do not control browser, you can't actually automate all users actions. For instance, TestCafe can't open new tabs or open a new browser window in incognito mode. There can be also some issues running tests on 3rd party servers or inside iframes.
NodeJS v 8.9 and higher required to start. CodeceptJS is multi-backend testing framework. It can execute tests using different libraries like webdriverio, Puppeteer, Protractor, etc.
trans-unit.target: Se requiere NodeJS v 8.9 y superior para comenzar. CodeceptJS es un marco de prueba de back-end múltiple. Puede ejecutar pruebas usando diferentes bibliotecas como webdriverio, Puppeteer, Protractor, etc.

trans-unit.source: Server mode - starts a webserver. Deigned for CI systems.

Simple Cross-Browser Support. Because TestCafe only launches browsers, it can automate browser on desktop or mobile. Unlike WebDriver, you don't need special version of browser and driver to prepare to run tests. Setup simplified. All you need is just a browser installed, and you are ready to go.

Simulated Events. Events like click or doubleClick are simulated by JavaScript internally. Inside WebDriver or Puppeteer, where those events are dispatched by a browser, called native events. Native events are closer to real user experience. So in some cases simulated events wouldn't represent actual user experience, which can lead to false positive results. For instance, a button which can't be physically clicked by a user, would be clickable inside TestCafe.

Stable to Execution. Because a test is executed inside a browser, the network latency effects are reduced. Unlike WebDriver you won't hit stale element exceptions, or element not interactable exceptions, as from within a web browser all DOM elements are accessible.

trans-unit.source: WebDriver has limited ability to mock requests, so you can only mock only requests performed after page is loaded. This means that you can't block Google Analytics, or CDN calls, but you can mock API requests performed on user action.

trans-unit.source: API Data Factory

Acceptance (also called End to End) tests can cover standard but complex scenarios from a user's perspective. With acceptance tests you can be confident that users, following all defined scenarios, won't get errors. We check not just functionality of application but a user interface (UI) as well.
trans-unit.target: Las pruebas de aceptación (también llamadas de extremo a extremo) pueden cubrir escenarios estándar pero complejos desde la perspectiva del usuario. Con las pruebas de aceptación, puede estar seguro de que los usuarios, siguiendo todos los escenarios definidos, no recibirán errores. Verificamos no solo la funcionalidad de la aplicación sino también una interfaz de usuario (UI).

trans-unit.source: Acceptance Testing
trans-unit.target: Pruebas de aceptación

trans-unit.source: Acceptance tests interact with a websites using UI and real browser. There is no way to create data for a specific test other than from user interface. That makes tests slow and fragile. Instead of testing a single feature you need to follow all creation/removal process.
trans-unit.target: Las pruebas de aceptación interactúan con un sitio web usando la interfaz de usuario y un navegador real.No hay forma de crear datos para una prueba específica que no sea desde la interfaz de usuario.Eso hace que las pruebas sean lentas y frágiles.En lugar de probar una sola característica,es necesario seguir todo el proceso de creación/eliminación.

trans-unit.source: All helpers share the same API so it's easy to migrate tests from one backend to other. However, because of difference in backends and their limitations, they are not guarantted to compatible between each other. For instance, you can't set request headers in WebDriverIO or Protractor, but you can do so in Puppteer or Nigthmare.
trans-unit.target: Todos los ayudantes comparten la misma API,por lo que es fácil migrar las pruebas de un backend a otro.Sin embargo,debido a la diferencia de los backends y sus limitaciones,no se garantiza la compatibilidad entre ellos.Por ejemplo,no se pueden establecer cabeceras de solicitud en WebDriverIO o Protractor,pero sí en Puppteer o Nigthmare.

trans-unit.source: All helpers share the same API, so it's easy to migrate tests from one backend to another. However, because of the difference in backends and their limitations, they are not guaranteed to be compatible with each other. For instance, you can't set request headers in WebDriver or Protractor, but you can do so in Puppteer or Nightmare.

trans-unit.source: Among all Selenium alternatives the most interesting emerging ones are tools developed around Google Chrome DevTools Protocol (opens new window). And the most prominent one is Puppeteer (opens new window). It operates over Google Chrome directly without requiring additional tools like ChromeDriver. So tests setup with Puppeteer can be started with npm install only. If you want get faster and simpler to setup tests, Puppeteer would be your choice.

Among all Selenium alternatives the most interesting emerging ones are tools developed around Google Chrome DevTools Protocol. And the most prominent one is Puppeteer. It operates over Google Chrome directly without requireing additional tools like ChromeDriver. So tests setup with Puppeteer can be started with npm install only. If you want get faster and simpler to setup tests, Puppeteer would be your choice.
trans-unit.target: Entre todas las alternativas de Selenium, las emergentes más interesantes son las herramientas desarrolladas en torno al protocolo Google Chrome DevTools . Y el más destacado es Titiritero . Funciona directamente sobre Google Chrome sin requerir herramientas adicionales como ChromeDriver. Por lo tanto, la configuración de las pruebas con Puppeteer solo se puede iniciar con npm install. Si desea obtener pruebas más rápidas y sencillas para configurar, Puppeteer sería su elección.

trans-unit.source: At the end of a test ApiDataFactory will clean up created record for you. This is done by collecting ids from crated records and running DELETE /api/users/{id} requests at the end of a test. This rules can be customized in helper configuration.
trans-unit.target: Al final de una prueba, ApiDataFactory limpiará el registro creado para usted. Esto se realiza mediante la recopilación de identificadores de los registros empaquetados y la ejecución de solicitudes DELETE /api/users/{id} al final de una prueba. Estas reglas se pueden personalizar en la configuración auxiliar.

trans-unit.source: At the end of a test GraphQLDataFactory will clean up created record for you. This is done by collecting data from crated records, creating deletion mutation objects by passing the data to the revert function provided, and sending deletion mutation objects as requests at the end of a test. This behavior is according the revert function be customized in helper configuration. The revert function returns an object, that contains the query for deletion, and the variables object to go along with it.

trans-unit.source: Behavior Driven Development
trans-unit.target: Desarrollo impulsado por el comportamiento

trans-unit.source: Behavior Driven Development (BDD) is a popular software development methodology. BDD is considered an extension of TDD, and is greatly inspired by Agile (opens new window) practices. The primary reason to choose BDD as your development process is to break down communication barriers between business and technical teams. BDD encourages the use of automated testing to verify all documented features of a project from the very beginning. This is why it is common to talk about BDD in the context of test frameworks (like CodeceptJS). The BDD approach, however, is about much more than testing - it is a common language for all team members to use during the development process.

Behavior Driven Development (BDD) is a popular software development methodology. BDD is considered an extension of TDD, and is greatly inspired by Agile practices. The primary reason to choose BDD as your development process is to break down communication barriers between business and technical teams. BDD encourages the use of automated testing to verify all documented features of a project from the very beginning. This is why it is common to talk about BDD in the context of test frameworks (like CodeceptJS). The BDD approach, however, is about much more than testing - it is a common language for all team members to use during the development process.
trans-unit.target: Behavior Driven Development (BDD) es una metodología de desarrollo de software popular. BDD se considera una extensión de TDD y está muy inspirado en las prácticas ágiles . La razón principal para elegir BDD como su proceso de desarrollo es romper las barreras de comunicación entre los equipos comerciales y técnicos. BDD fomenta el uso de pruebas automatizadas para verificar todas las características documentadas de un proyecto desde el principio. Es por eso que es común hablar de BDD en el contexto de marcos de prueba (como CodeceptJS). Sin embargo, el enfoque de BDD es mucho más que pruebas: es un lenguaje común para todos los miembros del equipo durante el proceso de desarrollo.
